title: DOJ Weaponization Operations and Prosecutor Targeting Network
description: Research systematic weaponization of Department of Justice for political persecution and prosecutor targeting operations from TTT analysis revealing coordinated capture mechanisms.
focus_areas: Special counsel appointment and termination coordination patterns
Prosecutor reassignment and targeting operations with specific timelines
Political interference in ongoing investigations documentation
DOJ leadership purge and loyalty-based replacement strategy
White House counsel coordination with DOJ operations
Attorney General directive patterns for political cases
Federal prosecutor office systematic capture mechanisms
DOJ Civil Rights Division targeting and neutralization
US Attorney office political coordination networks
methodology: Search existing timeline for DOJ weaponization events
Cross-reference prosecutor dismissals with political timeline
Document coordination between White House and DOJ operations
Track systematic interference patterns in specific investigations
Map DOJ leadership replacement networks and loyalty tests
source_analysis: Based on analysis of 31 TTT articles showing systematic DOJ weaponization patterns including prosecutor targeting, investigation interference, and political coordination mechanisms.
research_context: TTT articles 181-225 revealed extensive documentation of coordinated DOJ capture operations requiring timeline integration
